thread.title: HS Cross Country: Sheridan boys, Morgan girls claim district titles
thread.title_full: HS Cross Country: Sheridan boys, Morgan girls claim district titles

title: HS Cross Country: Sheridan boys, Morgan girls claim district titles
text:
HS Cross Country: Sheridan boys, Morgan girls claim district titles Staff report 9:59 p.m. EDT October 24, 2015 7 CONNECT 8 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
ZANESVILLE - The Sheridan boys and Morgan girls claimed team titles in Division II, as area teams competed in district meets across three divisions Saturday at a variety of locations. 
In Division II and III, the top four teams and 16 placers qualified for the regional meets at Pickerington North. 
The Generals scored 19 points — Fairfield Union was second with 91 — in the Division II, District 1 race at Rio Grande. 
Sheridan senior Joey Palumbo won in 16:13 followed by teammates, sophomore Luke Brown (16:25) and senior Clay Fisher (16:34), in second and third. Kyle Clellan came in sixth (16:54) and Gage Wells seventh (16:56) to round out the scoring, while Keith Clellan was also eighth (16:58) and Garrett Gwinn 12th (17:17). 
The Sheridan girls scored 43 points to finish second to Athens’ 37 in the District 2 race to also advance. Mackenzie Davis came in second (19:25), Emily Heath fourth (19:59), Anna Foster fifth (20:08), Kaeley Clonch 12th (20:55) and Chrystina Watson 23rd (22:04) for the Generals. 
The New Lexington girls were in the District 1 race, placing eighth with Hailey Groves leading the way in 18th (21:57), while the boys were ninth in District 2 as Andrew Stevenson finished 35th (18:47) to lead that effort. 
In Division III, Crooksville’s Dustin O’Neal qualified, finishing sixth in 17:53 as the Ceramics were seventh, while Paige Beish fell short in the girls race for Crooksville, placing 19th (24:19). 
• At Cambridge, the Raiders totaled 49 points to win the school’s first district championship, as Carrollton was second with 55 in the Division II, District 2 race. 
Jordan Penrod placed second (19:11), Jasmine Penrod sixth (20:10), Tayler Smith seventh (20:16), Jozi Brown 10th (20:22) and Brandi Ross 24th (21:37) for Morgan. 
Maysville’s Kaylin Roessler came in 17th (20:53) to miss qualifying by one spot in that race. 
The John Glenn girls were fourth in the District 1 race with 89 points, as Minerva won with 47. Karlie Zumbro led the Muskies in fourth (19:50), while Jenna Pethtel was 11th (20:42), Courtlyn Showman 20th (21:19), Bailey Johnson 27th (21:59) and Madison Hunter 29th (22:08). 
On the boys side, the Muskies took fourth in the District 2 race with 99 points. Martins Ferry used a sixth-man tiebreaker to beat River View for the team title, as both had 47 points. 
Dylan Curtis finished fifth (16:47), Isaiah Lilje 19th (17:42), Kyler Gossett 21st (17:52), Kyler Brock 26th (18:06) and Billy Young 28th (18:08) for the Muskies. 
Morgan senior Trace Schaad placed ninth in 17:30 to move on from the District 1 race. 
In Division III, Rosecrans freshman Maddie Douglas placed 13th (21:12) to advance. 
• In Division I at Watkins Memorial, the top five or six teams and 20 or 24 individuals, depending on the section, moved on to regionals. 
Tri-Valley’s Vance Pulley just qualified with a 23rd-place finish in 16:40 in Section 3, while the Scotties were 12th out of 16 teams. Caden Sauerbrey came in 31st (16:55). 
Chelsie Babcock led the Tri-Valley girls in 40th (21:18) as the Scotties were ninth out of 15 teams in their section. 
Kaleb Young led the Zanesville boys in 53rd (17:39), while Valerie Hickman came in 55th (23:22) for the girls. 7 CONNECT 8 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://ohne.ws/1S3veQA MORE STORIES
